sentences.english: She put away her powder compact and smiled kindly.
sentences.chinese: 她放好了粉盒，慈祥地微笑着。

sentences.english: He'll lovingly take you to your mansion in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 祂会慈祥地将你引领到天上的家。

sentences.english: My grandma has a very kind smile.
sentences.chinese: 我的奶奶有一幅很慈祥的笑容。

sentences.english: True is kindly, not smell is wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 不争是慈祥，不闻是智慧。

sentences.english: The poor good old woman was a spinster.
sentences.chinese: 那可怜慈祥的妇人是个老处女。

sentences.english: Martha was a very loving mother and grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 玛萨是位非常慈祥的母亲和祖母。

sentences.english: Year-old death of his father, to follow the kind of grandmother came to the grandfather's home.
sentences.chinese: 四岁丧父，跟随慈祥的外祖母来到了外祖父的家中。

sentences.english: She put away her compact and smiled kindly.
sentences.chinese: 她放好了粉盒，慈祥地微笑着。

sentences.english: He possesses a mild and benevolent countenance.
The old seagull looked at him kindly.
sentences.chinese: 这只老海鸥慈祥地望着他。

sentences.english: A shadow passed over the kindly face of the old woman.
sentences.chinese: 一道阴影掠过老太太慈祥的面孔。

sentences.english: The Buddha kindly said, "Tell me what you want to eat, and I'll get it for you."
sentences.chinese: 佛陀慈祥地说，“告诉我你想吃什么，我都会给你。”

sentences.english: Don't Wait for a smile to be nice.
sentences.chinese: 不要等到一个笑容才面露慈祥。

sentences.english: "What kind of seed are you?" The wisdom tree asks kindly.
sentences.chinese: “而你是什么的种子呢？”智慧之树慈祥地问阿狸。

sentences.english: Last night I again saw you smiling benignly.
sentences.chinese: 昨夜又见到你那慈祥的笑颜了。

sentences.english: He began to talk in his most gentle and avuncular manner.
sentences.chinese: 他开始讲话了，态度极其和蔼而慈祥。

definition: kind brows, pleasant eyes (idiom); amiable looking/benign-faced
kind brows, pleasant eyes (idiom); amiable looking/benign-faced
smiling wholeheartedly (idiom); beaming from ear to ear
